org.apache.juneau.internal

Class ClassUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils

  • public final class ClassUtils
extends Object
    Class-related utility methods.

      Simple bean that shows the name, parameter types, and return type of a method.

        Returns:
        An array of readable class type strings.

      • getReadableClassName

        Shortcut for calling getReadableClassName(c.getName())
        Parameters:
        c - The class.
        Returns:
        A readable class type name, or null if parameter is null.

      • getReadableClassNameForObject

        public static String getReadableClassNameForObject(Object o)
        Shortcut for calling getReadableClassName(c.getClass().getName())
        Parameters:
        o - The object whose class we want to render.
        Returns:
        A readable class type name, or null if parameter is null.

      • getReadableClassName

        public static String getReadableClassName(String className)
        Converts the specified class name to a readable form when class name is a special construct like "[[Z".
        Example:

        getReadableClassName("java.lang.Object"); // Returns "java.lang.Object" getReadableClassName("boolean"); // Returns "boolean" getReadableClassName("[Z"); // Returns "boolean[]" getReadableClassName("[[Z"); // Returns "boolean[][]" getReadableClassName("[Ljava.lang.Object;"); // Returns "java.lang.Object[]" getReadableClassName(null); // Returns null

        Parameters:
        className - The class name.
        Returns:
        A readable class type name, or null if parameter is null.

      • getClassFromReadableName

        public static Class<?> getClassFromReadableName(ClassLoader cl,
                                                String name)
                                         throws ClassNotFoundException
        Converts the string generated by getReadableClassName(Class) back into a Class.

        Generics are stripped from the string since they cannot be converted to a class.

        Parameters:
        cl - The classloader to use to load the class.
        name - The readable class name.
        Returns:
        The class object.
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException

                                    Class<?> child,
                                    boolean strict)
        Returns true if parent is a parent class of child.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent class.
        child - The child class.
        strict - If true returns false if the classes are the same.
        Returns:
        true if parent is a parent class of child.

      • getMethodSignature

        public static String getMethodSignature(Method m)
        Returns the signature of the specified method. For no-arg methods, the signature will be a simple string such as "toString". For methods with one or more args, the arguments will be fully-qualified class names (e.g. "append(java.util.StringBuilder,boolean)")
        Parameters:
        m - The methods to get the signature on.
        Returns:
        The methods signature.

      • getPrimitiveWrapper

        public static Class<?> getPrimitiveWrapper(Class<?> c)
        If the specified class is a primitive (e.g. int.class) returns it's wrapper class (e.g. Integer.class).
        Parameters:
        c - The class.
        Returns:
        The wrapper class, or null if class is not a primitive.

      • getPrimitiveForWrapper

        public static Class<?> getPrimitiveForWrapper(Class<?> c)
        If the specified class is a primitive wrapper (e.g. Integer.class) returns it's primitive class (e.g. int.class).
        Parameters:
        c - The class.
        Returns:
        The primitive class, or null if class is not a primitive wrapper.

      • getWrapperIfPrimitive

        public static Class<?> getWrapperIfPrimitive(Class<?> c)
        If the specified class is a primitive (e.g. int.class) returns it's wrapper class (e.g. Integer.class).
        Parameters:
        c - The class.
        Returns:
        The wrapper class if it's primitive, or the same class if class is not a primitive.

      • getMethodAnnotation

        public static <T extends Annotation> T getMethodAnnotation(Class<T> a,
                                                           Method m)
        Returns the specified annotation on the specified method.

        Similar to Method.getAnnotation(Class), but searches up the parent hierarchy for the annotation defined on parent classes and interfaces.

        Normally, annotations defined on methods of parent classes and interfaces are not inherited by the child methods. This utility method gets around that limitation by searching the class hierarchy for the "same" method.

        Parameters:
        a - The annotation to search for.
        m - The method to search.
        Returns:
        The annotation, or null if it wasn't found.

      • findNoArgConstructor

        public static final <T> Constructor<T> findNoArgConstructor(Class<T> c,
                                                            Visibility v)
        Locates the no-arg constructor for the specified class. Constructor must match the visibility requirements specified by parameter 'v'. If class is abstract, always returns null. Note that this also returns the 1-arg constructor for non-static member classes.
        Parameters:
        c - The class from which to locate the no-arg constructor.
        v - The minimum visibility.
        Returns:
        The constructor, or null if no no-arg constructor exists with the required visibility.

      • resolveParameterType

        public static Class<?> resolveParameterType(Class<?> c,
                                            int index,
                                            Class<?> oc)
        Finds the real parameter type of the specified class.
        Parameters:
        c - The class containing the parameters (e.g. PojoSwap<T,S>)
        index - The zero-based index of the parameter to resolve.
        oc - The class we're trying to resolve the parameter type for.
        Returns:
        The resolved real class.

      • findPublicMethod

        public static Method findPublicMethod(Class<?> c,
                                      String name,
                                      Class<?> returnType,
                                      Class<?>... parameterTypes)
        Finds a public method with the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        c - The class to look for the method.
        name - The method name.
        returnType - The return type of the method. Can be a super type of the actual return type. For example, if the actual return type is CharSequence, then Object will match but String will not.
        parameterTypes - The parameter types of the method. Can be subtypes of the actual parameter types. For example, if the parameter type is CharSequence, then String will match but Object will not.
        Returns:
        The matched method, or null if no match was found.

      • findPublicConstructor

        public static <T> Constructor<T> findPublicConstructor(Class<T> c,
                                                       Class<?>... parameterTypes)
        Finds a public constructor with the specified parameters without throwing an exception.
        Parameters:
        c - The class to search for a constructor.
        parameterTypes - The parameter types in the constructor. Can be subtypes of the actual constructor argument types.
        Returns:
        The matching constructor, or null if constructor could not be found.

      • findPublicConstructor

        public static <T> Constructor<T> findPublicConstructor(Class<T> c,
                                                       Object... args)
        Finds the public constructor that can take in the specified arguments.
        Parameters:
        c - The class we're trying to construct.
        args - The arguments we want to pass into the constructor.
        Returns:
        The constructor, or null if a public constructor could not be found that takes in the specified arguments.

      • getClasses

        public static Class<?>[] getClasses(Object... args)
        Returns the class types for the specified arguments.
        Parameters:
        args - The objects we're getting the classes of.
        Returns:
        The classes of the arguments.

        public static ClassUtils.MethodInfo getMethodInfo(Method m)
        Returns a ClassUtils.MethodInfo bean that describes the specified method.
        Parameters:
        m - The method to describe.
        Returns:
        The bean with information about the method.

      • getMethodInfo

        public static ClassUtils.MethodInfo[] getMethodInfo(Collection<Method> m)
        Returns ClassUtils.MethodInfo beans that describe the specified methods.
        Parameters:
        m - The methods to describe.
        Returns:
        The beans with information about the methods.
